title: What is a cash-balance plan?
description: A cash-balance plan is a defined benefit plan that is a whole lot like a traditional pension, but with a few elements that closely resemble a 401(k).
cleaned_text: A cash-balance plan is great if you're young and plan on job-hopping. But if you work for one company for a very long time - good luck pulling that off these days! - the total amount you'll get from a [traditional pension plan](/retirement/guide/pensions_pensions.moneymag/index.htm) is typically bigger than what you'll get from a cash-balance plan. That's because the formula for a traditional pension gives heavy weight to your average salary over the last few years of employment. With a cash-balance plan, it's a simple average of every year's salary. But it's not like you're going to be able to choose between them anyway. Generally, a company offers one or the other - or none at all.
